titles.title: A bill for the relief of David Butler, Aldo Cirone, Richard Denisi, Warren Fallon, Charles Hotton, Harold Johnson, Jean Lavoie, Vincent Maloney, Austin Mortensen, and Kurt Olofsson.

action.text: Referred to House Committee on The Judiciary.
Referred to Subcommittee on Administrative Law and Governmental Relations.
Subcommittee Consideration and Mark-up Session Held.
Forwarded by Subcommittee to Full Committee.
Committee Consideration and Mark-up Session Held.
Reported to House (Amended) by House Committee on The Judiciary. Report No: 100-291.
Called up by House on Call of Private Calendar.
Received in the Senate and read twice and referred to the Committee on Judiciary.
Referred to Subcommittee on Courts and Administrative Practice.
Subcommittee on Courts and Administrative Practice. Approved for full committee consideration without amendment favorably.

calendar.text: Committee on Judiciary. Ordered to be reported with amendments favorably.

action.text: Committee on Judiciary. Reported to Senate by Senator Biden with amendments. Without written report.

calendar.text: Placed on Senate Legislative Calendar under General Orders. Calendar No. 1102.

vote.text: Passed Senate with amendments by Voice Vote.

action.text: Message on Senate action sent to the House.

vote.text: House Agreed to Senate Amendments by Voice Vote.

bill.summary: 3/3/1987--Introduced. Directs the Secretary of the Treasury, through the United States Property and Fiscal Officer for the State of Massachusetts, to pay a specified sum to each of ten named individuals in full satisfaction of all claims against the United States arising from their unauthorized placement under the Federal Civil Service Retirement System upon reemployment with the Massachusetts National Guard.
